<h1>Text Elements</h1>

<h2>Headers &amp; Paragraphs</h2>
<h1>Header One</h1>
<p>Paragraph text. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque
    eu, pretium quis, sem. Nulla consequat massa quis enim. Donec pede justo, fringilla vel, aliquet nec, vulputate eget, arcu.</p>

<h2>Header Two</h2>
<p>More paragraph text so you can see the spacing of all the headers accurately. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur
    ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis, sem.</p>

<h3>Header Three</h3>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis,
    sem.</p>

<h4>Header Four</h4>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis,
    sem.</p>

<h5>Header Five</h5>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis,
    sem.</p>

<h6>Header Six</h6>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis,
    sem.</p>
<p>Double paragraphs for this one so you can see the spacing of the Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus
    mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis, sem.</p>

<h2>Blockquote</h2>
<blockquote>
    Here's a blockquote with the author's name. (The cite tag should be inside the blockquote tag.)
    <cite>Author Name</cite>
</blockquote>

<h2>Small</h2>
<small>The small tag is used for side-comments and small print, such as legal text or copyright.</small>

<h2>Time</h2>
<time>time</time>

<h2>Inline Text</h2>
<p>The <strong>Strong element</strong> represents text with strong importance.</p>

<p><em>Emphasized text</em> is used to indicate emphasis.</p>

<p><b>Bold text</b> is stylistically different from normal text, without any conveying any special importance or relevance.</p>

<p><i>Italisized text</i> is offset from it's surrounding content without conveying any extra emphasis or importance.</p>

<p><u>Underlined text</u> is text with an unarticulated, though explicitly rendered, non-textual annotation.</p>

<p><del>This text is deleted</del>, and <ins>this text is inserted.</ins></p>

<p>This is <s>Strikethrough text</s>.</p>

<p>This is superscript<sup>&copy;</sup> text.</p>

<p>Subscript text is like this: H<sub>2</sub>O.</p>

<p>Abbreviation looks like this: <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr>.</p>

<p>Keyboard input: <kbd>Cmd</kbd></p>

<p><q cite="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/HTML/Element/q">This text is a short, inline quotation.</q></p>

<p><cite>This is a citation</cite>. It defines the title of a work, such as a book, song, movie, or painting.</p>

<p>The <dfn>dfn element</dfn> represents the defining instance of a term.</p>

<p>The <mark>mark element</mark> indicates a highlight.</p>

<p>This is what <code>inline code</code> looks like.</p>

<pre><code>//This is what a block of code looks like
if(elements){
	elements.forEach(function(element){
		element.setAttribute("tabindex", "-1");
	});
}
</code></pre>

<p>This is <samp>sample output</samp> from a program or computing system looks like.</p>

<p>The <var>variable element</var> is used for variables, such as <var>x</var> = <var>y</var>.</p>

Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes, nascetur ridiculus mus. Donec quam felis, ultricies nec, pellentesque eu, pretium quis, sem. Nulla consequat massa quis enim. Donec pede justo, fringilla vel, aliquet nec, vulputate eget, arcu.</p>

<h2>Inline Text</h2>
<p>The <strong>Strong element</strong> represents text with strong importance.</p>

<p><em>Emphasized text</em> is used to indicate emphasis.</p>

<p><b>Bold text</b> is stylistically different from normal text, without any conveying any special importance or relevance.</p>

<p><i>Italisized text</i> is offset from it's surrounding content without conveying any extra emphasis or importance.</p>

<p><u>Underlined text</u> is text with an unarticulated, though explicitly rendered, non-textual annotation.</p>

<p><del>This text is deleted</del>, and <ins>this text is inserted.</ins></p>

<p>This is <s>Strikethrough text</s>.</p>

<p>This is superscript<sup>&copy;</sup> text.</p>

<p>Subscript text is like this: H<sub>2</sub>O.</p>

<p>Abbreviation looks like this: <abbr title="HyperText Markup Language">HTML</abbr>.</p>

<p>Keyboard input: <kbd>Cmd</kbd></p>

<p><q cite="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/HTML/Element/q">This text is a short, inline quotation.</q></p>

<p><cite>This is a citation</cite>. It defines the title of a work, such as a book, song, movie, or painting.</p>

<p>The <dfn>dfn element</dfn> represents the defining instance of a term.</p>

<p>The <mark>mark element</mark> indicates a highlight.</p>

<p>This is what <code>inline code</code> looks like.</p>

<pre><code>//This is what a block of code looks like
if(elements){
	elements.forEach(function(element){
		element.setAttribute("tabindex", "-1");
	});
}
</code></pre>

<p>This is <samp>sample output</samp> from a program or computing system looks like.</p>

<p>The <var>variable element</var> is used for variables, such as <var>x</var> = <var>y</var>.</p>
 
/* No context defined for this component. */
  • Content: 
    ::selection {
    color: $white;
    background-color: $zuccini;
}

body {
    -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
    -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
    @include primary-font(400);
    font-size: px-to-rem(16px);
    color: $emperor;
    line-height: 1.5;
}

h1 {
    @include secondary-font(600);
    font-size: px-to-rem(36px);
    line-height: 1.3;
    color: $zuccini;
    margin-bottom: $bottom-margin;

    @media ($breakpoint-lg) {//~1100px +
        font-size: px-to-rem(46px);
    }
}

h2 {
    @include secondary-font(600);
    font-size: px-to-rem(26px);
    line-height: 1.3;
    color: $mine-shaft;
    margin-bottom: px-to-rem(16px);

    @media ($breakpoint-lg) {//~1100px +
        font-size: px-to-rem(36px);
    }
}

h3 {
    @include primary-font(600);
    font-size: px-to-rem(21px);
    line-height: 1.3;
    color: $mine-shaft;
    margin-bottom: px-to-rem(16px);

    @media ($breakpoint-lg) {//~1100px +
        font-size: px-to-rem(24px);
    }
}

h4 {
    @include secondary-font(500);
    font-size: px-to-rem(18px);
    line-height: 1.3;
    color: $mine-shaft;
    margin-bottom: px-to-rem(16px);
}

h5 {
    @include primary-font(600);
    font-size: px-to-rem(16px);
    line-height: 1.3;
    color: $mine-shaft;
    margin-bottom: px-to-rem(8px);
}

h6 {
    @include secondary-font(600);
    font-size: px-to-rem(13px);
    line-height: 1.3;
    color: $emperor;
    margin-bottom: px-to-rem(8px);
}

p {
    font-size: px-to-rem(16px);
    margin-bottom: px-to-rem(32px);
}

small {
    font-size: px-to-rem(16px);
    color: $dove-gray;
}

sup, sub {
    font-size: 75%;
}

sup {
    top: -0.5rem;
}

sub {
    bottom: -0.5rem;
}

blockquote {
    position: relative;
    @include tertiary-font();
    font-size: px-to-rem(24px);
    font-weight: 400;
    font-style: italic;
    color: $zuccini;
    padding: 0 px-to-rem(24px);
    margin-bottom: px-to-rem(32px);

    &::before {
        content: '“';
        position: absolute;
        top: 0;
        left: 0;
    }

    cite {
        display: block;
        font-size: px-to-rem(16px);
        color: $dove-gray;
        margin-top: px-to-rem(16px);

        &::before {
            content: '– ';
        }
    }

    @media ($breakpoint-lg) {//~1100px +
        font-size: px-to-rem(36px);
    }
}
